Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 08:44PM ChristinS wrote: Hi Just Judi!  I am a single mom with elementary school aged twins and work in a doctors office--i have only 1 income so not working is not, for me an option either...i miss work for treatment times & 4 days since July including my bilateral mastectomy surgery...its not easy; its like the other posters have all said, we have purell by the front door and NOBODY comes in without squirting it on first; nobody can lay around on anyone elses's pillow, etc, you have to become a germ-o-phobe (never use anyone else's phone/pen/etc, & constantly wash your own hands...) and then you just do it, even when you're exhausted because for those 8 1/2-9 hours a day its not about the cancer; its a mental vacation...i also think its good for the kids to see that you still do most of your normal routine...i have overheard my own kids; 1 will say mommy looks sick today, and then the other will say she's not that sick, she is going to work, shes probably just tired again...i'm sure its awful on you as a mom to see your daughter go thru this, but i'm sure she will be wise and cautious and get through it
Posts.Title: Working while doing chemo ? JustJudi talbrig13
